.method public static hidebysig void CopySpansFrom(class Android.Text.ISpanned source, int32 start, int32 end, class Java.Lang.Class kind, class Android.Text.ISpannable dest, int32 destoff) cil managed

Docs.summary: Copies the spans from the region start...end in source to the region destoff...destoff+end-start in dest.

remarks.para: Copies the spans from the region start...end in source to the region destoff...destoff+end-start in dest. Spans in source that begin before start or end after end but overlap this range are trimmed as if they began at start or ended at end.

Docs.exception: if any of the copied spans are out of range in dest.

Docs.summary: Debugging tool to print the spans in a CharSequence.

remarks.para: Debugging tool to print the spans in a CharSequence. The output will be printed one span per line. If the CharSequence is not a Spanned, then the entire string will be printed on a single line.

Docs.summary: Returns the original text if it fits in the specified width given the properties of the specified Paint, or, if it does not fit, a truncated copy with ellipsis character added at the specified edge or center.

remarks.para: Returns the original text if it fits in the specified width given the properties of the specified Paint, or, if it does not fit, a truncated copy with ellipsis character added at the specified edge or center.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.ICharSequence EllipsizeFormatted (Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, Android.Text.TextPaint paint, float avail, Android.Text.TextUtils.TruncateAt where, bool preserveLength, Android.Text.TextUtils.IEllipsizeCallback callback);

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.ICharSequence EllipsizeFormatted(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence text, class Android.Text.TextPaint paint, float32 avail, class Android.Text.TextUtils/TruncateAt where, bool preserveLength, class Android.Text.TextUtils/IEllipsizeCallback callback) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the original text if it fits in the specified width given the properties of the specified Paint, or, if it does not fit, a copy with ellipsis character added at the specified edge or center.

remarks.para: Returns the original text if it fits in the specified width given the properties of the specified Paint, or, if it does not fit, a copy with ellipsis character added at the specified edge or center. If preserveLength is specified, the returned copy will be padded with zero-width spaces to preserve the original length and offsets instead of truncating. If callback is non-null, it will be called to report the start and end of the ellipsized range. TextDirection is determined by the first strong directional character.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string[] Split (string text, Java.Util.Regex.Pattern pattern);
.method public static hidebysig string[] Split(string text, class Java.Util.Regex.Pattern pattern) cil managed

Docs.summary: Splits a string on a pattern.

remarks.para: Splits a string on a pattern. String.split() returns [''] when the string to be split is empty. This returns []. This does not remove any empty strings from the result.

Docs.exception: if expression or text is null

MemberSignature.Value: public static string[] Split (string text, string expression);
.method public static hidebysig string[] Split(string text, string expression) cil managed

Docs.summary: String.split() returns [''] when the string to be split is empty.

remarks.para: String.split() returns [''] when the string to be split is empty. This returns []. This does not remove any empty strings from the result. For example split("a,", "," ) returns {"a", ""}.

Docs.exception: if expression or text is null

Docs.summary: Create a new String object containing the given range of characters from the source string.

remarks.para:
Create a new String object containing the given range of characters from the source string. This is different than simply calling
in that it does not preserve any style runs in the source sequence, allowing a more efficient implementation.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
